alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 22 at 2:03PM MDT until April 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...BLIZZARD TO IMPACT NORTHEAST WYOMING TO NORTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA THIS WEEKEND... .A robust spring storm will bring heavy snow accumulations and very strong winds this weekend to portions of northeastern Wyoming and northwestern South Dakota, including the northern Black Hills. Heavy snow of 10 to 18 inches is expected across northeast Wyoming, along with northwest wind gusts over 60 mph. Heavy snow and wind gusts to 70 mph are expected across northwest South Dakota. This will result in white out conditions across these areas and the northern Foothills. The northern Black Hills will see significant snowfall of up to 24 inches, with locally higher amounts possible, but winds will be weaker than across the surrounding plains. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Western Crook County, Northern Campbell County and Northeastern Crook County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook
